page.title: 02THE TOWN OF CHRISTCHURCH
page.content: CHRISTCHURCH IS SITUATED ON THE SOUTH COAST OF ENGLAND WHERE THE RIVERS STOUR AND AVON ENTER THE SEA. IT HAS A SHALLOW HARBOUR WHICH IS POPULAR WITH SAILORS BUT IT IS NOT DEEP ENOUGH FOR COMMERCIAL TRAFFIC. AS THE TOWN IS OLD AND HAS A BEAUTIFUL PRIORY IT IS A POPULAR PLACE FOR TOURISTS TO VISIT AND ALTHOUGH THERE ARE FEW HOTELS AND GUEST HOUSES THERE IS A HOLIDAY CAMP SITUATED NEAR THE TOWN CENTRE ON THE QUAY. THERE IS ALSO A LEISURE PARK AND MODEL VILLAGE NEARBY WHICH ATTRACTS MANY VISITORS. CHRISTCHURCH HAS SOME LIGHT INDUSTRY BUT THERE IS NOT MUCH IN THIS BLOCK AS IT IS MAINLY HOUSING AND SHOPS. A NEW SHOPPING PRECINCT CALLED SAXON SQUARE HAS RECENTLY OPENED NEAR THE HIGH STREET AND THIS CONTAINS A LARGE SUPERMARKET AND MANY ATTRACTIVE SHOPS.
